keywords: C. elegans / condensate / nucleoporin / oocyte / aging
@graph.name: Source images for "Nucleoporin foci are stress-sensitive condensates dispensable for C. elegans nuclear pore assembly"

@graph.description: C. elegans oocytes, embryos, and somatic tissues
@graph.name: Source images for "Nucleoporin foci are stress-sensitive condensates dispensable for C. elegans nuclear pore assembly"

@graph.description:
To image germlines or somatic cells, a 20 μm Z stack (1 μm step size) was captured using a 63x objective (Zeiss) with the 1x relay lens. For high resolution images of oocytes, 3 μm Z stacks (0.1 μm step size) were acquired using the 63x objective with the 2.8x relay lens. As germline condensates are highly sensitive to imaging-induced stress (Elaswad et al., 2022), care was taken to avoid compression of germlines, and all animals were imaged only once and maintained on the slide for <5 min. To image entire worms, an 80 μm Z stack (1 μm step size) was captured using a 10x objective (Zeiss) with the 1x relay lens.
Embryos were imaged as 15 μm Z stacks (1 μm step size), captured using the 63x objective with the 2.8x relay lens. For imaging fixed germlines and embryos, prepared slides were imaged as 15 μm Z stacks (0.5 μm step size), captured using the 63x objective with the 2.8x relay lens.
@graph.labEquipment: Zeiss Axio Observer with CSU-W1 SoRa spinning disk scan head (Yokogawa), 1x/2.8x/4x relay lens (Yokogawa), and an iXon Life 888 EMCCD camera (Andor) controlled by Slidebook 6.0 software (Intelligent Imaging Innovations)
@graph.name: Source images for "Nucleoporin foci are stress-sensitive condensates dispensable for C. elegans nuclear pore assembly"
